In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    result *= "$line" # add the remaining string to the result
    return result
end
```

You can use this function like this:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Cras ultricies."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will output the string `s` wrapped at a maximum width of 10 characters per line:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Cras ultricies.
```
